editorialReviews: Editorial Reviews About the Author Stjepan Sejic is a Croatian artist known for works like WITCHBLADE, APHRODITE IX, and the smash-hit BDSM romance comic SUNSTONE.

body.description: How do you deal with a broken heart? Junk food? Excessive drinks? Dubious contracts with ancient gods? When it comes to Lauren Thomas, the queen of bad decisions, the answer is always the worst possible choice. She finds herself in a rare opportunity to have her broken heart patched up by the highest rated god of desire. The problem is, it’s a contested title. Join us in this tale of gods and mortals, love lust and death and one woman's bad choice that starts it all with a simple bite on a golden apple. Read more

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 21, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Fun art and a very interesting storyline! Characters do have depth to be further explored. Printed on nice paper and shiny. Excited to buy the next one!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 29, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Deeply erotic, well illustrated, and surprisingly deep, this tale well draw you deeply into the concepts of forbidden love, duty, pain and healing, the meaning and value of relationships, redemption, self-worth, and primal hunger that strips us down to our animal selves. Comics don't often venture into such territory, but this one does so well and boldly.I just wish there was more to be had.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 23, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Like the first hour of a 2-hour pilot
reviews.reviewText: Fine Print; Or, How a Divine Contract May Not Be the Best Cure For a Broken Heart is a new graphic novel series from Stjepan Šejić, the author/artist of Sunstone, and is even more steamy and erotic than the latter title. As is typical of Šejić's work, the art is magnificent, the colors are dynamic and eye-catching, the characters are engaging, the facial expressions are superb, and even the smuttiest scenes serve a purpose in the overall story.The one notable flaw is that we don't get enough of that story.The premise for the overall series is pretty simple: a model named Lauren Thomas is granted a magical contract that would summon the greatest of all cubi (gods of desire) to fulfill her every sexual need; unfortunately, the title of "greatest" is currently a contested one, so Lauren gets both the finalists and must judge for herself which of them is the winner. What is not at all simple is all the backstory and worldbuilding that has to go into such a premise. And so Šejić spends so much of volume 1 showing us who and what the cubi are, why the contracts exist and why they're so important, how Lauren's love life has gone so wrong that she would try such a contract in the first place, and what the stakes are for everybody involved, that the actual premise itself that I outlined above doesn't get fully set up. Instead, we're left with a sort of awkward cliffhanger to be taken up next issue, like when the two-hour pilot of a TV series would get split up into two one-hour episodes for the reruns. Which leaves the book gorgeous, intriguing, and sexy as anything, but not all that satisfying narratively. That said, I still can't wait for volume 2.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 5, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I don't know what I was looking for but I like it
reviews.reviewText: This was on my wish list for a while I saw it advertise somewhere and I just saved it and recently I decided what the heck let's just buy it and now that I finished it I wish the second one would come out sooner than December. The illustrations are fantastic the storyline is intriguing. Can't wait for December.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 10, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Simply amazing, intriguing and leaves me hungering for more.
reviews.reviewText: Simply amazing, intriguing and it leaves me hungering for more.I will love to see more of this book as it becomes a series.

Absolutely beautiful artwork, definitely NSFW. Will be a a great and very enjoyable read. Very excited for volume 2 out in April. Story holds on its own and the artwork is a wonderful added bonus. Happy reading!
Vi trechos pelo Twitter e fiquei interessada, desenho maravilhoso e história envolvente, ansiosa pelo próximo volume.

Stjepan Sejic da la impresión de ser muy lúbrico, y sí, en este cómic hay una batalla entre el deseo y el amor, el arte no desentona, aunque parece que tenía el tiempo encima, hay uno que otro panel al que normalmente, como hemos visto en sus otros trabajos, como en la mini-serie de Harley Quinn, podría ser un poco más prolijo.Se lee fácil y fluido si el aspecto del erotismo en todas sus facetas no te provoca algún resabio.

Leider bisher nur auf Englisch zu erhalten und so ein bisschen Sprachverloren neben unserer deutssprachigen Sonnenstein Sammlung. Aber inhaltlich, erzählerisch und künstlerisch ein großartiges Werk, dass lose in der gleichen Welt angesiedelt ist.Durch die unheimlich gute Erzählweise und die epischen Bilder vergisst man beim lesen zwischenzeitlich fast, dass es sich um eine Geschichte mit viel Erotik handelt.Ich freue mich definitiv schon auf den zweiten Band.
Llegó en estado impecable, además de ser un gran cómic.
